_comment: AUTO-GENERATED FILE - DO NOT EDIT. Generated by scripts/compile.ts. Run: bun run compile
name: method-ui

accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.description: A vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each reveal a section of content.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: Single item expansion by default
examples.source: What is React? React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components. What is Solid? SolidJS is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces with fine-grained reactivity. What is Vue? Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

examples.title: Collapsible
examples.description: Allow all panels to be closed
examples.source: Can I close all items? Yes! With the collapsible prop, you can close all accordion items by clicking the open item. Is it animated? Absolutely. The accordion uses smooth CSS animations for opening and closing.

examples.title: Multiple
examples.description: Allow multiple panels to be open simultaneously
examples.source: Features Full keyboard navigation, collapsible items, and smooth animations built-in. Accessibility Complies with WAI-ARIA design patterns and supports screen readers. Styling Fully customizable with Tailwind CSS and class variance authority.

examples.title: Outlined
examples.description: Accordion with outlined styling
examples.source:
Installation New
Install the package using your favorite package manager: npm install @ark-ui/solid Usage Import the components and start building your accordion UI with full TypeScript support.
Customization Updated
Use CVA variants and Tailwind classes to customize the look and feel.

examples.title: Disabled
examples.description: Accordion with disabled items
examples.source: Available This accordion item is available and can be toggled. Disabled This item is disabled and cannot be opened. Enabled This accordion item is also available.

angle-slider.name: AngleSlider
angle-slider.description: An angle slider component for selecting angular values (0-360 degrees). Built on Ark UI AngleSlider - all Ark UI AngleSlider props are supported.

props.name: centerValue
props.type:
| boolean
    | JSX.Element
    | ((context: { value: number; valueAsDegree: string }) => JSX.Element)

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple angle slider with the value displayed in the center
examples.source:
<AngleSlider
  id="angle-slider-basic"
  label="Wind Direction"
  defaultValue={21}
  centerValue
/>

examples.title: Custom Step with Markers
examples.description: An angle slider with 45-degree step increments and aligned markers, with wrapping disabled
examples.source:
<AngleSlider
  id="angle-slider-step"
  label="Rotation"
  defaultValue={90}
  step={45}
  markers={[0, 45, 90, 135, 180, 225, 270, 315]}
  centerValue
/>

examples.title: Disabled
examples.description: A disabled angle slider with reduced opacity
examples.source:
<AngleSlider
  id="angle-slider-disabled"
  label="Disabled"
  defaultValue={135}
  showMarkers
  disabled
  centerValue
/>

examples.title: Custom Size
examples.description: An angle slider with custom size dimensions

chart.name: Chart
chart.description: A powerful chart component built with Apache ECharts. Supports multiple chart types including bar, line, pie, scatter, radar, gauge, funnel, and candlestick charts. Automatically integrates with your design system

examples.description: Real-time updating line chart with gradient fill

examples.title: Interactive Bar Chart with Gradient
examples.description: Bar chart with gradient colors and zoom interaction

examples.description: A pie chart showing data distribution with theme colors
examples.source: {b}: {c} ({d}%)", }, legend: { orient: "vertical", left: "left", }, series: [ { name: "Products", type: "pie", radius: "50%", data: [ { value: 335, name: "Product A" }, { value: 310, name: "Product B" }, { value: 234, name: "Product C" }, { value: 135, name: "Product D" }, { value: 1548, name: "Product E" }, ], }, ], }} id="pie-chart" />

examples.title: Heatmap Chart

examples.title: Organization Tree Chart
examples.description: Hierarchical tree visualization of an organization structure
examples.source:
<Chart
  size="lg"
  option={{
    tooltip: {
      trigger: "item",
      triggerOn: "mousemove",
    },
    series: [
      {
        type: "tree",
        data: [
          {
            name: "CEO",
            children: [
              {
                name: "CTO",
                children: [
                  {
                    name: "Engineering",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Frontend Team" },
                      { name: "Backend Team" },
                      { name: "DevOps Team" },
                    ],
                  },
                  {
                    name: "Product",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Design Team" },
                      { name: "Research Team" },
                    ],
                  },
                ],
              },
              {
                name: "CFO",
                children: [
                  {
                    name: "Finance",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Accounting" },
                      { name: "Treasury" },
                    ],
                  },
                  {
                    name: "Legal",
                    children: [{ name: "Compliance" }],
                  },
                ],
              },
              {
                name: "CMO",
                children: [
                  {
                    name: "Marketing",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Content Team" },
                      { name: "Social Media" },
                      { name: "SEO Team" },
                    ],
                  },
                  {
                    name: "Sales",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Enterprise Sales" },
                      { name: "SMB Sales" },
                    ],
                  },
                ],
              },
            ],
          },
        ],
        top: "5%",
        left: "7%",
        bottom: "2%",
        right: "20%",
        symbolSize: 7,
        label: {
          position: "left",
          verticalAlign: "middle",
          align: "right",
          fontSize: 12,
        },
        leaves: {
          label: {
            position: "right",
            verticalAlign: "middle",
            align: "left",
          },
        },
        emphasis: {
          focus: "descendant",
        },
        expandAndCollapse: true,
        animationDuration: 550,
        animationDurationUpdate: 750,
      },
    ],
  }}
  id="tree-chart"
/>

dialog.name: Dialog
dialog.description: A modal dialog component with composable parts. Uses Ark UI for accessibility and focus management.

examples.title: Basic Dialog
examples.description: A simple dialog with trigger, title and description
examples.source:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger>
    <Button>Open Dialog</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogTitle>
      Dialog Title
      <Badge variant="secondary" class="ml-2">
        New
      </Badge>
    </DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      This is a basic dialog with a title and description.
    </DialogDescription>
    <DialogFooter>
      <DialogClose>
        <Button variant="outline">Close</Button>
      </DialogClose>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>

examples.title: Controlled Dialog
examples.description: Control dialog state externally
examples.source:
const dialog = createDialogState();
return (
  <>
    <Button onClick={dialog.open}>Open Dialog</Button>
    <Dialog
      open={dialog.isOpen()}
      onOpenChange={(e) => dialog.setOpen(e.open)}
    >
      <DialogContent>
        <DialogTitle>Controlled Dialog</DialogTitle>
        <DialogDescription>
          This dialog is controlled by external state using the
          createDialogState helper.
        </DialogDescription>
        <DialogFooter>
          <Button variant="outline" onClick={dialog.close}>
            Close
          </Button>
        </DialogFooter>
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
  </>
);

examples.title: Dialog with Form
examples.description: Dialog containing form elements
examples.source: Edit Profile Make changes to your profile here. Click save when you're done.

input.name: Input
input.description: Form input component built with Ark UI Field. Supports type variants: text, email, password (with toggle), textarea (with autoresize), and tags (multi-value input). Use with Field.Root for labels, helper text, and error states when needed.

json-tree-view.name: JsonTreeView
json-tree-view.description: A component for displaying and exploring JSON data in a tree structure. Perfect for debugging, API responses, and configuration viewers.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: Display JSON data in a tree view with various data types
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="User Data"
  data={{
    name: "John Doe",
    age: 30,
    email: "john.doe@example.com",
    balance: 1234.56,
    score: -42,
    isActive: true,
    isVerified: false,
    avatar: null,
    description: undefined,
    createdAt: new Date("2024-01-15T14:22:00.000Z"),
    lastLogin: new Date("2024-01-12T00:00:00.000Z"),
    tags: ["user", "premium", "verified"],
    scores: [95, 87, 92, 78, 100],
    address: {
      street: "123 Main St",
      city: "Anytown",
      state: "CA",
      zip: 12345,
      coordinates: {
        lat: 37.7749,
        lng: -122.4194,
      },
    },
    greet: (name: string) => `Hello, ${name}!`,
    emailPattern: /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/,
    lastError: new Error("Something went wrong"),
    preferences: new Map([
      ["theme", "dark"],
      ["language", "en"],
      ["notifications", "enabled"],
    ]),
    visitedPages: new Set(["/home", "/profile", "/settings"]),
    mixedData: [
      "string",
      42,
      true,
      null,
      { nested: "object" },
      [1, 2, 3],
      new Date(),
    ],
  }}
/>

examples.title: Expand Depth
examples.description: Control how many levels are expanded by default
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="Configuration"
  defaultExpandedDepth={1}
  data={{
    server: {
      host: "localhost",
      port: 3000,
      ssl: {
        enabled: true,
        cert: "/path/to/cert",
        key: "/path/to/key",
      },
    },
    database: {
      host: "db.example.com",
      port: 5432,
      credentials: {
        username: "admin",
        password: "********",
      },
    },
  }}
/>

examples.title: Array Data
examples.description: Display arrays and nested structures
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="API Response"
  data={{
    users: [
      { id: 1, name: "Alice", active: true },
      { id: 2, name: "Bob", active: false },
      { id: 3, name: "Charlie", active: true },
    ],
    meta: {
      total: 3,
      page: 1,
      perPage: 10,
    },
  }}
/>

examples.title: Mixed Types
examples.description: Display various JavaScript data types
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="Data Types"
  defaultExpandedDepth={2}
  data={{
    string: "Hello World",
    number: 42,
    boolean: true,
    null: null,
    undefined: undefined,
    array: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5],
    object: {
      nested: "value",
      deep: {
        deeper: "data",
      },
    },
  }}
/>

examples.title: Button Trigger with Icons
examples.description: Menu with button trigger and icon items
examples.source:
<Menu>
  <MenuTrigger variant="outline">
    <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-settings" />
    Actions
  </MenuTrigger>
  <MenuContent>
    <MenuItem value="new">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-file-plus" />
      New File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="open">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-folder-open" />
      Open File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="save">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-save" />
      Save
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuSeparator />
    <MenuItem value="settings">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-settings" />
      Settings
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="exit">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-log-out" />
      Exit
    </MenuItem>
  </MenuContent>
</Menu>

/>

examples.description: Multiple selection with indicators
examples.source:
<Select multiple>
  <SelectPlaceholder>Select frameworks</SelectPlaceholder>
  <SelectItem value="react">React</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="solid">Solid</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="vue">Vue</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="svelte">Svelte</SelectItem>
</Select>

signature-pad.name: SignaturePad
signature-pad.description: A signature pad component for capturing handwritten signatures. Built on Ark UI SignaturePad - all Ark UI SignaturePad props are supported.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple signature pad with label and clear button
examples.source: <SignaturePad label="Sign below" />

examples.title: With Image Preview
examples.description: Display a preview of the signature as an image
examples.source:
const [imageUrl, setImageUrl] = createSignal(""); return (
details.getDataUrl("image/png").then((url) => setImageUrl(url)) } />

Preview:
);

examples.title: Custom Stroke Color
examples.description: Signature pad with custom stroke color
examples.source:
<SignaturePad
  label="Sign in blue"
  drawing={{ fill: "#3b82f6", size: 2 }}
/>

examples.title: Composable
examples.description: Build custom layouts with composable parts
examples.source:
<SignaturePadRoot class="w-full max-w-2xl">
  <SignaturePadLabel>Please sign here</SignaturePadLabel>
  <SignaturePadControl class="h-64">
    <SignaturePadSegment />
    <SignaturePadClearTrigger class="absolute top-2 right-2">
      Reset
    </SignaturePadClearTrigger>
    <SignaturePadGuide class="absolute bottom-16 left-0 right-0" />
  </SignaturePadControl>
</SignaturePadRoot>

skeleton.name: Skeleton
skeleton.description: A skeleton component for displaying loading states. Use to show a placeholder while content is loading.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: Simple skeleton loader

examples.title: Card
examples.description: Skeleton for a card layout

examples.title: List
examples.description: Skeleton for a list of items

examples.title: Table
examples.description: Skeleton for a table layout

slider.name: Slider
slider.description: A slider component for selecting values within a range. Built on Ark UI Slider - all Ark UI Slider props are supported.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple slider with label and value display
examples.source:
<Slider
  id="slider-basic"
  label="Volume"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[50]}
  max={100}
  step={1}
/>

examples.title: With Custom Steps
examples.description: A slider with decimal step increments
examples.source:
<Slider
  id="slider-custom-steps"
  label="Opacity"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[0.5]}
  min={0}
  max={1}
  step={0.1}
/>

examples.title: Range Slider
examples.description: A slider with two thumbs for selecting a range
examples.source:
<Slider
  id="slider-range"
  label="Price Range"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[25, 75]}
  max={100}
  step={1}
/>

examples.title: Disabled
examples.description: A disabled slider
examples.source:
<Slider
  id="slider-disabled"
  label="Disabled"
  showValue
  defaultValue={[60]}
  max={100}
  disabled
/>

tabs.name: Tabs
tabs.description: A tabs component that allows users to switch between different views. Supports multiple variants and smooth animations.

examples.description: Pill-style tabs with muted background
examples.source:

Vue

theme.name: Theme
theme.description: A flexible theme system that treats all themes equally. Define any number of themes and let users build custom controls with the provided utilities.

toast.name: Toast
toast.description: A toast notification system built on Ark UI. Features stacking, gestures, promise handling, and full customization.

examples.title: Setup
examples.description: Create toaster instances for different positions

examples.title: Promise & Update Toasts
examples.description: Handle async operations and update toasts dynamically

examples.title: Duration & Limits
examples.description: Control duration and maximum visible toasts

tooltip.name: Tooltip
tooltip.description: A tooltip that provides additional information on hover. Features smooth animations, customizable delays, and flexible positioning.

examples.title: Basic Tooltip
examples.description: A simple tooltip with default settings
examples.source:
<Tooltip>
  <TooltipTrigger>
    <Button variant="outline">Hover me</Button>
  </TooltipTrigger>
  <TooltipContent>I am a tooltip!</TooltipContent>
</Tooltip>

examples.title: On Buttons
examples.description: Tooltips on interactive button elements
examples.source: Save changes Delete item More information

examples.title: On Badges
examples.description: Tooltips providing context for status badges
examples.source:
Active Service is running normally
Pending Awaiting approval
Error Service encountered an error

examples.title: Rich Content
examples.description: Tooltip with formatted content
examples.source:
Pro Tip

You can hover over this tooltip and interact with its content.

tree-view.name: TreeView
tree-view.description: A tree view component that displays hierarchical data in an expandable structure. Perfect for file explorers, navigation menus, and nested lists.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple tree view with folders and files
examples.source:
<TreeView
  label="Project Files"
  data={[
    {
      id: "node_modules",
      name: "node_modules",
      children: [
        { id: "node_modules/zag-js", name: "zag-js" },
        {
          id: "node_modules/@types",
          name: "@types",
          children: [
            { id: "node_modules/@types/react", name: "react" },
            {
              id: "node_modules/@types/react-dom",
              name: "react-dom",
            },
          ],
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: "src",
      name: "src",
      children: [
        { id: "src/app.tsx", name: "app.tsx" },
        { id: "src/index.ts", name: "index.ts" },
      ],
    },
    { id: "package.json", name: "package.json" },
    { id: "readme.md", name: "README.md" },
  ]}
/>

examples.title: With Selection
examples.description: Tree view with single selection enabled
examples.source:
<TreeView
  label="Documentation"
  selectionMode="single"
  defaultSelectedValue={["docs/getting-started"]}
  data={[
    {
      id: "docs",
      name: "Documentation",
      children: [
        { id: "docs/getting-started", name: "Getting Started" },
        { id: "docs/installation", name: "Installation" },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: "examples",
      name: "Examples",
      children: [
        { id: "examples/react", name: "React Examples" },
        { id: "examples/vue", name: "Vue Examples" },
      ],
    },
  ]}
/>

{node.name} )} renderItem={(node) => ( <>
